summary: This bill, the "Reducing Homelessness Through Program Reform Act," amends the McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act and other related laws to improve programs addressing homelessness. It modifies the Emergency Solutions Grants and Continuum of Care programs, covering administrative costs, definitions, and program requirements. Key provisions include measures for cost adjustments, program modifications for the Housing Choice Voucher program, technology upgrades, coordination between health and housing services, establishment of an Advisory Committee on Homelessness, streamlining coordinated entry and documentation requirements, and improving data collection. Ultimately, the bill aims to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of homelessness assistance programs.
